mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Ross, David
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Cover letter and proposal from a group of Virginia tobacco traders led by David Ross, offering to supply France's Farmers General with tobacco and asking whether Jefferson could help facilitate the transaction; the proposal outlines the terms of an agreement, which would be an annual purchase in lieu of a set contract due to volatile market conditions.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1785 October 18, Richmond, [Virginia], to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
